alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 7:06PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Birch Creek near Circle * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of low lying areas along Birch Creek is occurring. Water is flowing overbank and flooding portions of the Steese Highway from Milepost 145 to 147. Increased debris and erosion is also expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 625 PM AKDT, DOT reported recent heavy rain has caused Birch Creek to flow overbank. On Wednesday, flooding was observered in Central with Crooked Creek and many other small streams flooding. This water is now moving down Birch Creek. Water levels are expected to begin to fall on Friday at the Steese Highway bridge over Birch Creek as the crest moves downstream. - For Birch Creek at the Steese Highway near Circle: At 6:00pm the stage was 19.1 feet and continuing to rise. - http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along Birch Creek stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
